intro: Cyanea angustifolia var. lanaiensis, commonly known as the Lanai hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
